subject: Science
objectives: To understand the need for measurement.
To learn about the systems of units (CGS and MKS).
To study basic units of measurement for length, mass, and time.
To learn about measurement of temperature.

concepts.title: Need for Measurement
concepts.description: Measurement allows us to quantify physical properties and compare them. It is essential in science, engineering, and everyday life.
keyPoints: Measurements are crucial for calculations and predictions.

concepts.title: Systems of Units
concepts.description: Two main systems of units are CGS and MKS (SI). SI is the modern form of MKS and is internationally accepted.
keyPoints: SI system: Based on MKS, with additional base units for other physical quantities.

concepts.title: Basic Units of Measurement
concepts.description: Fundamental physical quantities have base units from which other units are derived.
keyPoints: Length: Meter (m) in SI, Centimeter (cm) in CGS.
Mass: Kilogram (kg) in SI, Gram (g) in CGS.
Time: Second (s) in both CGS and SI.

questions.text: What is the SI unit for length?
questions.explanation: The meter (m) is the base unit of length in the International System of Units (SI).

questions.text: Which instrument is used to measure time?
questions.explanation: A clock is used to measure time intervals.

questions.text: Temperature is measured in which SI unit?
questions.explanation: The Kelvin (K) is the SI base unit for thermodynamic temperature.

questions.text: Which unit is used for mass in the CGS system?
questions.explanation: In the CGS system, mass is measured in grams (g).

questions.text: What is the primary function of measurement in science?
options: To allow for quantification and comparison
questions.explanation: Measurement provides objective data that can be used for comparisons and calculations.

questions.text: Which of the following is a derived unit?
questions.explanation: A Newton (N) is a derived unit of force, calculated from base units like mass, length, and time.

questions.text: Why is the SI system preferred internationally?
options: It is older and more traditional
It is simpler to use for all calculations
It provides a standardized and consistent system for global scientific communication
It is only used in a few countries
questions.explanation: The SI system's standardization ensures consistency in measurements and facilitates international scientific collaboration.

questions.text: What is the purpose of using a thermometer?
questions.explanation: A thermometer is specifically designed to measure temperature.

questions.text: Which SI unit is used for electric current?
questions.explanation: The Ampere (A) is the SI unit for electric current.

questions.text: Which of these is NOT a base unit in the SI system?
questions.explanation: A Liter is a unit of volume, which is a derived unit, not a base unit. Base units include meter, kilogram, second, Kelvin, mole, ampere, and candela.

questions.text: What does 'CGS' stand for in terms of measurement systems?
questions.explanation: CGS stands for Centimeter, Gram, and Second.
